item.title: [317 - DELTA] Custom Minigame help [rep++!]
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

client temp = (client) server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].getKiller()];

Is found no where in my NPCHandler.Java file.

EDIT:
I searched:

.getKiller()
in NPCHandler.Java found a couple of results.

Looked down a bit and found:

if (npcs[i].npcType == noteditedyet) { temp.sM("Notedityet"); temp.typeofpoint += 1; }

I think this is it. Thanks for the help!
Rep++'d

Read full topic

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Custom Minigame help [rep++!]
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

[quote=“jaruanna, post:3, topic:432486”]npcPoint + 1;
not += 1[/quote]

  • 1 would only work in a statement. When assigning a value, += should be used.

Read full topic

npcPoint + 1;
not += 1

EDIT: try oh-noes first.

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Custom Minigame help [rep++!]
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

If you want something to happen when in NPC is killed, you need to use NPCHandler. Inside, search for:

Then, under

You can add your NPC code. For example:

if(npcs[i].npcType == 1264) { temp.npcPoint ++; }

Read full topic

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Custom Minigame help [rep++!]
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

Okay so i’ve created my own custom minigame.

Everything works according to plan except,

When they kill the last npc, it’s supposed to give them 1 NPC POINT. They need to kill him 10 times to get to the next area.

Only, when they kill him it doesn’t give them an NPC POINT.

Here’s my NPC’s Case in Client.Java

if(NPCID == 1264) { npcPoint += 1; if(hitTwice && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 5698 && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 4827 && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 861){ DDS2Damg = true; specialAtk(true, 25, 1062, 0x426); DDS2Damg2 = true; specGFX(1062); usingSpecial = true;

}
}

I’m pretty sure it’s set up correctly.

If anyone can help me, I’ll Rep++!

Read full topic
